body:
would this require an upgrade in C++ STL? 
If not, i think we should just upgrade to C++14 or something, because that replaces a lot of the things that boost currently has

> just upgrade to C++14

There is ongoing discussion on when the right time is to bump c++. It seems the plan is to skip c++14 and go straight to c++17, but it'll probably be a while: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/13356#issuecomment-537977292 and https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/16684

Getting rid of Boost altogether is not likely to happen anytime soon, see e.g. https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/8670 (2016!)
As this doesn't bump the minimum required version of boost, just the one used in depends, it's ok with me.

> Boost 1.71 or newer is useful for #15382.

[Release notes for Boost 1.71.0](https://www.boost.org/users/history/version_1_71_0.html) do not mention any change in `Process` library (required in #15382) at all. Did I miss something?
It fixes an unused variable, which is needed to pass Travis these days.

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#16367](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16367.html) (Multiprocess build support by ryanofsky)
* [#10102](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/10102.html) ([experimental] Multiprocess bitcoin by ryanofsky)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
